meanings.definition: To make a copy using a xerographic process.
meanings.sent1: She xeroxed the important document for her boss.
meanings.sent2: The secretary xeroxed the report for the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The office prankster xeroxed a picture of a funny face.
meanings.sent4: His memory xeroxed the image of her smile for eternity.
meanings.sent5: The copier xeroxed the paper with lightning speed.

meanings.definition: A copy made using a xerographic process.
meanings.sent1: He handed out xeroxes of the presentation to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The file cabinet was filled with xeroxes of old documents.
meanings.sent3: The stack of xeroxes on his desk looked like a paper mountain.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a collection of xeroxes of past experiences.
meanings.sent5: The room was cluttered with xeroxes of various reports.
